Articles.Content:
This is the third craft I made based on one of Star Citizen's ships... this one is the M50 from Origin Jumpworks. It's said to be the type of ship meant to go from point A to point B fast. Made with 100% stock parts.

I used this pic as a reference.

http://img3.wikia.nocookie.net/__cb20130629142242/starcitizen/images/a/a6/M50_032713_notes.jpg

Here's my KSP design.

After some trial and error, I cut out the fuel tanks in the far back and replaced them with fuselage structure pieces while placing RCS tanks in the front to move the center of mass forward. The highest the ship can go is around 45000m.

Craft file: http://www./view/9msbnuiwnfp4mwf/Origin_M50.craft

If you like this, check these other ships out:

F7A Hornet http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/66618-Star-Citizen-F7A-Hornet

300i http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/66854-Star-Citizen-300i

Edited July 17, 2014 by pheeph
After a thorough analysis of design all i can say is ... ... Wow.

Hahaha, great work.

I didn't expected anyone to try re-creating SC ship in KSP, mostly because SC ships are.... well, very different from KSP "tube"-based design, but you made it surprisingly well.

Sweet! So while you're waiting for Star Citizen to come out you can fly one of these

JR
